register.description: IP revision identifier

bitfield.description: IP revision

register.description: This register allows controlling various parameters of the OCP interface.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Set to 1 to clear dynamic registers

bitenum.description: Clear status done, no pending action

bitfield.description: Internal OCP clock gating strategy:

bitenum.description: Automatic OCP clock-gating strategy is applied based on the OCP interface activity.

register.description: Register containing the received message, from the CTL_IN interface or MSG_IN interface

bitfield.description: Bit to allow dynamic reconfiguration – not used
Bit set to 1 in input message if an acknowledge message must be returned.
Message type 0: Acknowledge message 1: Activation message
Synchronous message type: 0 Synchronous 1: Asynchronous
Task identifier of the destination node
Task identifier of the message sender
Node identifier of the message sender

register.description: Contains the node identifier. Initialized by default to the tie-off value.

bitfield.description: Node identifier value

register.description: Register containing the node and task identifier to send an activation message when an error is detected

bitfield.description: Validity bit use to send or not the error message to a CPU based node
Identifier for the task in charge of recovering error
Identifier for the node in charge of recovering error

register.description: Contains the different errors latched during message decoding. Any write to the register resets the current value.

bitfield.description: Identifier of the task (or event line) to which error is attached.
4 bits coding the error code

register.description: Each bit in this register defines whether the corresponding asynchronous line event need an acknowledge upon task completion or directly when the line is raised.

bitenum.description: No acknowledge message expected on this line.
Acknowledge message expected on this line.
No acknowledge message expected on this line.
Acknowledge message expected on this line.
No acknowledge message expected on this line.
Acknowledge message expected on this line.
No acknowledge message expected on this line.
Acknowledge message expected on this line.
No acknowledge message expected on this line.
Acknowledge message expected on this line.
No acknowledge message expected on this line.
Acknowledge message expected on this line.

register.description: Modulo value for the configuration parameter pointer computed by SYNCBOX

bitfield.description: Number of macroblock configuration arrays in pipeline
EndOfTask FIFO empty (0) or not empty (1)
Status bit for task 5
EndOfTask FIFO empty (0) or not empty (1)
Status bit for task 4
EndOfTask FIFO empty (0) or not empty (1)
Status bit for task 3
EndOfTask FIFO empty (0) or not empty (1)
Status bit for task 2
EndOfTask FIFO empty (0) or not empty (1)
Status bit for task 1
EndOfTask FIFO empty (0) or not empty (1)
Status bit for task 0

register.description: Contains the task and node identifier to send the activation message to, upon detection of an asynchronous event

bitfield.description: Validity bit of current register content: If set to 0, the two fields dest_node_id and dest_task_id can be ignored; if set to 1, the two fields dest_node_id and dest_task_id are used to send activation message.
Destination task identifier telling at which task in the destination node the activation message must be sent upon task completion
Destination node identifier

register.description: Contains the task and node identifier to send the activation message to, upon detection of an asynchronous event

bitfield.description: Validity bit of current register content: If set to 0, the two fields dest_node_id and dest_task_id can be ignored; if set to 1, the two fields dest_node_id and dest_task_id are used to send activation message.
Destination task identifier telling at which task in the destination node the activation message must be sent upon task completion
Destination node identifier

register.description: Contains destination task identifier and destination node identifier for activation messages to be sent upon task completion. Valid bit is used to loop on all registers of the bundle.

register.description: Applies for synchronous task description of bit fields given below. For asynchronous task, only the 16 LSBs are used. Each of the 16 LSBs corresponds to a 1 hot encoding value for the node identifier. 16 MSBs write access is protected by the corresponding bit in the register.

bitfield.description: For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the task ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. This quad bit contains the task ID to which the ack message must be sent at end of processing.

For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the task ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. This quad bit contains the node ID to which the ack message must be sent at end of processing.

For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the task ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. This quad bit contains the task ID to which the ack message must be sent at end of processing.

For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the task ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. This quad bit contains the node ID to which the ack message must be sent at end of processing.
For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the node ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. Bit i set to 1 means an activation message is awaited from node i.
For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the node ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. Bit i set to 1 means an activation message is awaited from node i.
For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the node ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. Bit i set to 1 means an activation message is awaited from node i.
For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the node ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. Bit i set to 1 means an activation message is awaited from node i.

register.description: Applies for synchronous task description of bit fields given below. For asynchronous task, only the 16 LSBs are used. Each of the 16 LSBs corresponds to a 1 hot encoding value for the node identifier. 16 MSBs write access is protected by the corresponding bit in the register.

bitfield.description: For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the task ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. This quad bit contains the task ID to which the ack message must be sent at end of processing.

For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the task ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. This quad bit contains the node ID to which the ack message must be sent at end of processing.

For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the task ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. This quad bit contains the task ID to which the ack message must be sent at end of processing.

For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the task ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. This quad bit contains the node ID to which the ack message must be sent at end of processing.
For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the node ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. Bit i set to 1 means an activation message is awaited from node i.
For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the node ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. Bit i set to 1 means an activation message is awaited from node i.
For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the node ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. Bit i set to 1 means an activation message is awaited from node i.
For synchronous message: Each quad bit contains the node ID of a potential activator for asynchronous message. Bit i set to 1 means an activation message is awaited from node i.

register.description: Contains the four activation counters

bitfield.description: Bit set to 1 when all activation messages received
Associated counter with the fourth activator
Associated counter with the third activator
Associated counter with the second activator
Associated counter with the first activator

register.description: Contains the four activation counters

bitfield.description: Bit set to 1 when all activation messages received
Associated counter with the fourth activator
Associated counter with the third activator
Associated counter with the second activator
Associated counter with the first activator

register.description: NewTask counter

bitfield.description: Counter of the number of times the NewTask signal has been activated. This is not a macroblock counter because N MB can be processed every call.

register.description: NewTask counter

bitfield.description: Counter of the number of times the NewTask signal has been activated. This is not a macroblock counter because N MB can be processed every call.

register.description: Base address for the node configuration parameters

bitfield.description: 128-bit address

register.description: Base address for the node configuration parameters

bitfield.description: 128-bit address

register.description: Contains the parameter address increment to be added to the current parameter address pointer

bitfield.description: Value of the increment

register.description: Contains the parameter address increment to be added to the current parameter address pointer

bitfield.description: Value of the increment

register.description: Interface register containing the current value of the MB configuration parameters. This register is read by the node core.

bitfield.description: 16-bit value containing a 128-bit pointer

register.description: Interface register containing the current value of the MB configuration parameters. This register is read by the node core.

bitfield.description: 16-bit value containing a 128-bit pointer
